suncertify.rmi

Interface DatabaseAccessRemote

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DatabaseAccessRemoteImpl

    public interface DatabaseAccessRemote
extends java.rmi.Remote
    The interface to allow the Networked Client to make calls to the database with the same API as the Standalone Client.
    Since:
    07/05/2014
    Author:
    Luke GJ Potter

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
      Creates a new record in the database.
      void deleteRecord(long recNo, long lockCookie)
      Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage unavailable for reuse by setting an "invalid" flag for the record.
      long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
      Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria.
      long lockRecord(long recNo)
      Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client.
      java.lang.String[] readRecord(long recNo)
      Reads a record from the file.
      void unlock(long recNo, long cookie)
      Releases the lock on a record.
      void updateRecord(long recNo, java.lang.String[] data, long lockCookie)
      Modifies the fields of a record.

    • Method Detail

      • readRecord

        java.lang.String[] readRecord(long recNo)
                              throws RecordNotFoundException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record field.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The record number in the database to retrieve.
        Returns:
        A String array representation of the database record.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - When locating a record that does not exist, or had been previously deleted.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a problem with the network.

      • updateRecord

        void updateRecord(long recNo,
                java.lang.String[] data,
                long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.lang.SecurityException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException
        Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n]. Throws SecurityException if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The record number in the database to update.
        data - The string array representation of a database record, containing the updates.
        lockCookie - The cookie that the row is locked with.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - When locating a record that does not exist, or had been previously deleted.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the record is locked by a user other than the user trying to update the record.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a problem with the network.

      • deleteRecord

        void deleteRecord(long recNo,
                long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.lang.SecurityException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage unavailable for reuse by setting an "invalid" flag for the record. Throws SecurityException if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.
        Parameters:
        recNo - The record number in the database to delete.
        lockCookie - The cookie that the row is locked with.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - When locating a record that does not exist, or had been previously deleted.
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the record is locked by a user other than the user trying to update the record.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a problem with the network.

      • findByCriteria

        long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n].

        For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".

        Parameters:
        criteria - The search criteria to match against.
        Returns:
        An array of record numbers that match the criteria.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a problem with the network.

      • createRecord

        long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
                  throws DuplicateKeyException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException
        Creates a new record in the database. Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record.
        Parameters:
        data - The string array representation of a database record.
        Returns:
        The record number of the position that the record was created.
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException - When trying to create a record that already exists in the database.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a problem with the network.

      • lockRecord

        long lockRecord(long recNo)
                throws RecordNotFoundException,
                       java.rmi.RemoteException
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number to lock
        Returns:
        A long representing the lock's owner's id.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - When locating a record that does not exist, or had been previously deleted.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a problem with the network.

      • unlock

        void unlock(long recNo,
          long cookie)
            throws java.lang.SecurityException,
                   java.rmi.RemoteException
        Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException.
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number to unlock
        cookie - the cookie to unlock the record with
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - If the record is locked by a user other than the user trying to update the record.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - If there is a problem with the network.
